p: CVD including coronary artery disease and stroke, is the leading cause of mortality among adults worldwide, posing a major socio-economic burden. According to WHO World Heart Day ( 1), 17.7 million people die of CVDs every year, accounting for 31% of all-cause deaths in the world. In the European Union, over 1.8 million deaths occur from CVDs, equivalent to 20% of all deaths annually ( 2, 3).
